013package org.apache.juneau.svl;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
016
017/**
018 * Interface for the resolution of vars that can have one or more keys where the first non-null resolution is returned.
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * For example, to resolve the system property <js>"myProperty"</js> but then resolve <js>"myProperty2"</js> if the
022 * property doesn't exist: <js>"$S{myProperty1,myProperty2}"</js>
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * Subclasses must implement the following method:
026 * <ul class='javatree'>
027 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #resolve(VarResolverSession, String)}
028 * </ul>
029 *
030 * <ul class='seealso'>
031 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.SimpleVariableLanguage">Simple Variable Language</a>
032
033 * </ul>
034 */
035public abstract class MultipartResolvingVar extends SimpleVar {
036
037   /**
038    * Constructor.
039    *
040    * @param name The name of this variable.
041    */
042   public MultipartResolvingVar(String name) {
043      super(name);
044   }
045
046   @Override /* Var*/
047   public String doResolve(VarResolverSession session, String s) throws Exception {
048      int i = s.indexOf(',');
049      if (i == -1)
050         return resolve(session, s.trim());
051      for (String s2 : split(s)) {
052         String v = resolve(session, s2);
053         if (v != null)
054            return v;
055      }
056      return null;
057   }
058}
